Kedoran Alliance Merchant Alta: I came here since I was worried, but I won't dare to go in there by myself.{nl}That's why I am asking you.
I can't just wonder into places like that you know.{nl}There are monsters just sitting there...
There's rumors of the Alembique Legend among the refugees.{nl}I wanted to know the truth.
{nl}There might be products that the Alliance is looking for...{nl}Since you were going to explore the cave anyways, it's like hitting two Popolions with one stone.
{nl}I'll give you this book as payment.{nl}It'll be better than going in blind will it not?
Priest Lintas is correcting the contents of the monument.{nl}The process is taking some time.
Thanks to you, the monument has been corrected.{nl}We need to check up on the status of Priest Kidas and Brunas.
Even with the help, a flechette is nowhere to be found.{nl}I should go back to my master after sorting things out a bit in here.
Aquilas
I came here to learn archery but am just running errands finding that blasted arrow...{nl}If I knew that I had to look for arrows. I would not have started this journey...{nl}
I mean, this is all because of Lydia Schaffen.{nl}She should have taken her Flechette or whatever if she had used it to kill Ghibulinas!
{nl}Who cares if she is a legendary person.{nl}She doesn't know how to look after her things.
{nl}I can't understand my master.{nl}I don't know how I can be forgiven if I find that Flechette or whatever.
{nl}Even if I do somehow agree that it is important... I don't get how reporting on the vegetation is supposed to be important.{nl}Ugh... Not my kind of work.
I'd be really grateful if you'd offer any type of help.{nl}First of all, could you get me some Poppy Bracken, Aily Grass and Pria Flowers.
{nl}What do they have to do with the legendary arrow?{nl}I have no idea either.
Stupid Flechette or whatever it's called...
Mechen
I thought that Aquilas had come to report...{nl}This place is dangerous due to all of the monsters and demons.
{nl}How about leaving if you don't have any important business.
{nl}Oh?{nl}Ah, you're a Revelator.
{nl}It seems as if you are curious as to what my apprentices and I are doing here.{nl}Have you heard anything from Aquilas?
{nl}Oh, I am a member of the Astral Tower and sibling to the former leader.{nl}I made a big mistake while Ignas was trying to take control of the Astral Tower.
{nl}Ignas didn't miss out on the opportunity and took over the Astral Tower.{nl}Of course, the rest of the members don't look upon me so kindly.
{nl}No matter how I tell them that it was a mistake, they refuse to listen.
{nl}That's why I have decided to try and find Lydia Schaffen's Flechette to try and undo my wrongdoings.
{nl}They'll at least pretend to listen if I bring back the Flechette.{nl}I've come to this place as I am almost certain that her Flechette must be in Ghibulinas Forest.
{nl}My apprentices and I have been trying to look for the Flechette but there's been no progress.
I see you've gathered it all.{nl}Thanks.
{nl}Go to the camp and ask my master if you're wondering why we had to do this.
{nl}Well, I'd better start looking at these unremarkable things to find something different.
Hmm... I thank you for your eagerness, but this place is much too dangerous with all of the demons roaming around. {nl}I would appreciate it if you would simply ask my apprentices how they are doing.
{nl}Woognis is at the Vilkas Nest, Jenonhas is at Kainen Crossing.
Whoa, you scared me! Who are you?
{nl}The current situation?{nl}I haven't even gone anywhere near the area since I'm too afraid.
{nl}That over there is the Vilkas nest, but how am I supposed to get in there.{nl}I don't know, maybe I'll be able to get there if I cover myself with Vilkas fur...
We'll be put in danger if we go and fight Vilkas near their nest.{nl}There are a lot of Vilkas at Kyrba Lot as well.
{nl}Why don't we try gathering Vilkas fur over there.
There's a lot of Vilkas at Kyrba Lot, so it should be easy enough to get their fur there.
I think we'll be able to fool them into thinking we're one of their friends with this amount of fur.
I'm thinking of going to search their nest with this fur all over me.{nl}It's quite large so I don't know how long it will take but...
There's no reason for me to decline your offer of help.{nl}Let's go.
There doesn't seem to be a Flechette where I checked.{nl}Did you find anything?
{nl}Ah yes...{nl}Nothing...
So my search has resulted in nothing.{nl}You said that you were gathering reports?
{nl}There are two other apprentices.{nl}One is Aquilas and the other is Jenonhas.
{nl}Aquilas is on the road to Phamer Forest and Jenonhas is at Kainen Crossing.{nl}You said that you've already met Aquilas, so try looking for Jenonhas.
I'll return after wrapping things up here.
Jenonhas
Thank you so much.{nl}I wouldn't have made it if you hadn't come here.
Yes, that is correct.{nl}I am looking for the Flechette.
{nl}If it was something that could have been found so easily, people would have already taken it, don't you think?{nl}This is pointless.
{nl}There are even demons here.{nl}I can't understand my orders this time round.
{nl}I'm going to have to talk about this later.
Everyone is exhausted since they're searching for an arrow that seems to be non-existant.{nl}Especially where there are so many demons roaming around...
{nl}It's all because I am not skilled enough.
The first Fletcher Master crafted the Flechette for Lydia Schaffen.{nl}Of course I thought about asking the Fletcher Master.
{nl}But the Fletcher Master and the other members of the Astral Tower... They won't talk to me because they think I am a traitor.{nl}That's why I am not even thinking about it.
Of course I would appreciate the help but...{nl}I'm sure that it won't make a difference.
{nl}Don't be too disappointed though.{nl}The Fletcher Master is at the Goddess' Ancient Garden.
Fletcher Master
You said that Mechen asked you to find the Flechette?{nl}You still came to me knowing what kind of person he is correct?
{nl}Of course I might think of helping him if he agrees to return the Flechette after finding it.{nl}However, he'll show his true colors as soon as we find the Flechette.
If you say that, I'll agree to help.
{nl}This is a recipe for detecting the Flechette.{nl}Take this to Mechen.
The Goddess' Ancient Garden...{nl}It will be a long trip.
He gave you a recipe that will allow us to craft equipment that will help us detect the Flechette?
{nl}How did he decide to help us?
{nl}Ah...
{nl}I see.{nl}He agreed to help us under the condition of having my life if I do not give the Flechette.
{nl}I don't think that will be necessary.{nl}I'll take a look at this recipe then...
Mechen is the person who allowed the previous leader for the Astral Tower, his brother, to be taken down.
{nl}How can I trust such a person.
The Flechette is said to be crafted from the divine energy of the Goddess.{nl}It says that we have to get the energy of a powerful demon since it will react to their energy.
I'm worried that he might make us go and find capture a demon.
You've collected a lot.{nl}Now what we need is...
The recipe says that we need Vilkas essence in order to control the demon's energy.
My apprentices have gone to different locations to gather Vilkas essence.{nl}Could you please go to Kyrba Lot?
All you have to do is gather Vilkas essence from Kyrba Lot.
We have gathered all of the materials needed to create the detector.{nl}I'll start crafting it then.
I've finished crafting the detector.{nl}I'm going to give it to my apprentices to try and find the Flechette.
{nl}I guess it will make it easier to find the Flechette.
If you wish to participate in finding the Flechette, please start at Taylie Lot.{nl}The other places will be covered by my apprentices.
{nl}Try using the detector at Taylie Lot at places you think the Flechette might be.{nl}It will react if the Flechette is nearby.
Go to Taylie Lot and look for the Flechette.
Ah, have you found the Flechette?{nl}It feels a bit abrupt after all that fruitless time we spent searching for it...
{nl}Of course, none of us are Revelators...{nl}Good job.
{nl}Now it's time to take the Flechette to the Fletcher Master.
Please be careful.{nl}I wish that this would help resolve the misunderstanding between us.
This... it is the Flechette that was created by my elders.{nl}I didn't think that Mechen would give it this easily.
{nl}Hmm...{nl}Take this.{nl}Tell him that this is a sort of reward for finding me the Flechette.
{nl}I don't know how much good it will do for his honor...{nl}But people will at least know how much he went through to find the Flechette.
A promise is a promise, so I'll hand it over.
This... it's an Arrow of Proof crafted by the Fletcher Master...{nl}I hope people will listen to me a bit more if I have this.
This will help Mechen recover some of his honor.
Hello there.
{nl}We are apprentices of Maven.{nl}We are rewriting the misinformation that has been spread about the Ruklys incident on this Monument.
{nl}These were almost destroyed because of the actions for King Kadumel.{nl}However, King Barynwell decided to cast magic on them to make them unreadable instead.
{nl}We are preparing to undo the magic and make the corrections.{nl}The monsters are stopping us from doing anything though.
We will gladly accept any help you can offer us.
{nl}First of all, we need to find the documents.{nl}These documents contain instructions on how to dispell transfiguration magic, but they've been scattered due to monster attacks.
{nl}We were careful in making any further moves since we don't want to provoke any more monster attacks.
{nl}Please try looking at Othorove Lot first.
We need those documents to dispell the magic and correct the information on this Monument.
I see that they've all been scattered like this.{nl}Thank you for gathering all of the pages.
{nl}Now...
We'll have to find an orb in order to dispell the magic.{nl}The orb will quickly be depleted so we also had a recharging orb.
The orb will absorb the energy from the recharging orb.{nl}Therefore, you should be able to find where the orb is if you carry this around with you.
The recharging orb will emmit magic when activated.{nl}The magic will go towards the orb since it will try to absorb it and will glow when it does so.
{nl}All you have to do is to find the orb.
Magic will come out of the recharging orb when it is activated.{nl}You'll be able to find the orb if you follow it.
Oh, thank you so much!{nl}Now that we have the orbs...
We have finished all of the preparations required to dispel the magic on King Kadumel's Monument.
You've dealt with the Gosal?{nl}I can't believe that you took that thing on single handed when the three of us...
{nl}You don't seem to be just another traveler for some reason...
Whatever the case may be, the Gosal is gone, so we'll be able to go there.{nl}We'll have to check Tarkha Lot to see what the object is.
This thing that looks like a tree is actually an monument.{nl}This is all because of the spell.
{nl}We'll dispell it with the orb you've recovered for us.
The monument has now returned to it's original shape.{nl}We'll now find any pieces of misinformation and correct them.
We've finished correcting this one, so we'll have to search for other monuments.
{nl}Please, follow me.
Here it is.{nl}I will dispell the magic that is cast on the monument.
I think that the spores from this bracken have caused the paralysis.{nl}I can't dispell the magic in this state.
{nl}We'll have to wait for me to be able to move again.
{nl}You can find Mittelly Herbs near Ausne Lot.{nl}Mittelly Herbs are known to cure such issues.
There should be plenty of Mittelly Herbs near Ausne Lot.
{nl}I'm sorry for being so dependant when you simply volunteered to help...
There are people that have started to deny the existance of the Goddesses after they have all disappeared.{nl}I want to help them believe once more.
{nl}However...{nl}I lost my faith in people... as well as the Seed...{nl}{nl}
At this rate...{nl}I am afraid that I might lose all faith in humanity...{nl}Not a good thing for a priest...
Ah, that feels much better.{nl}I don't think it has completely healed me, but it is enough to allow me to dispell the magic.
All Vaivora's Koru is able to tell us is that Goddess Ausrine is in a mysterious place.
What do you think that the mysterious place will look like?{nl}We have more questions than answers...
Goddess Lada is said to be at Seir Rainforest.{nl}The closest place is most likely Arcus Forest.
I suppose I'll be able to meet her if I go to Seir Rainforest?
Will you be so kind as to remove the bracken from the Monument?{nl}I'll be paralyzed once more if you don't do so.
{nl}I doubt it will burn because of all the humidity in this area.{nl}Maybe using the dry skin of the Vilkas would be enough to light a proper fire.
If the plague rears it's ugly head once more the people of Kiren Province won't stand a chance.
I never even imagined that there would be bracken with paralyzing spores.{nl}Thank you so much for helping me out.
{nl}However... I can't imagine that you are just a simple traveler.
I see that all the bracken has burned.{nl}I'll dispell the magic on the Monument.
Hmm... I've checked the Monument, but it seems as if this one doesn't need to be corrected.
Ah, you have gathered quite a lot.{nl}I'm sure that they'll burn nicely even in this humidity.
The paralysis doesn't seem to be getting any better.{nl}What should I do...?
Thank you so much.{nl}I'll give you the detector that had allowed me to find the Monuments.{nl}All you need to do is to use it near an object you think might be a Monument.
Use the detector near anything you think might be a Monument.{nl}The detector will let you know it's a Monument by creating a circle around it.
You've found a Monument.{nl}I think I am well enough to move now, so let's head over there.
I've dispelled the magic and checked what is written on the Monument.{nl}However, it is hard to see what is on it since it has been badly damaged.
There might be fragments nearby.{nl}Could you please check the surrounding area?
There should be fragments from the Monument nearby.
Ah, I see that you've collected quite a few fragments.{nl}Let me check those.
I've checked all of the fragments you brought back.{nl}There's a few that have misinformation on them, so please give me a second to correct them.
Priest Kidas
Have you come all this way to help?{nl}May you be blessed by the Goddesses.
{nl}Checking the contents of this Monument will be difficult.{nl}As you can see, there are too many vines surrounding it.
{nl}Brunas and myself were trying to get rid of the vegetation here, but we couldn't find any useful materials.
{nl}We'd like to use Vilkas salivary glands since they have strong abrasive properties, but getting them is a problem since they won't just give them to us.
Getting them to give us the salivary glands is quite hard...{nl}We'll have to wait for them to become weak after attacking them.
{nl}You will have to feed them Mytiharyn Grass when they're weakened. This will make them salivate abrasive saliva.{nl}You will have to finish them off now and get the salivary glands.
Of course, they might attack you and resist eating the Mytiharyn Grass, so please be careful.
The salivary glands you brought should be enough.{nl}However...
We need water to dilute the poison from the salivary glands you brought.{nl}Brunas went to Putas Lot to get the water, but hasn't come back for a while...
I hope everything is okay...
Priest Brunas
Thank you. You saved my life.{nl}Ah, you've collected all of the salivary glands needed?
{nl}We'll be able to get rid of the vegetation once I take this water there then.{nl}I'll hurry back to Kidas then.
I've heard that you helped Kidas and Brunas a lot.{nl}Thank you for allowing us to finish our work. It had been stalled for a long time.
{nl}I knew I was right in thinking you're not just a normal traveler.
{nl}Whomever you may really be, may you be blessed by the Goddesses.
We are planning on publishing a book with the corrections made to these Monuments in order to allow more people to know about the truth.
{nl}Please make sure to take a look at the book if you have a chance to do so.{nl}Thank you for all the helped you gave us.
This is an area where a plague that caused fevers in people before leading them to their death.{nl}It's a bit quiet at the moment, but we don't know when it'll become worse again.
{nl}I'm in the middle of researching that plague.
I might die before I get anywhere near completing a cure if you don't help me.
I am going to send the cure to the Plague Doctor Master when it is complete.{nl}I will try strengthening it just in case.
Go and see how Woognis is doing at the Vilkas Nest.
Something must have happened to Priest Lintas who was dispelling the magic from the monument. Approach him to see what is wrong.
Kidas has removed the vegetation from the Monument and is taking a closer look.{nl}It seems to be taking much longer than expected.
You've come back.{nl}I heard that you saved Brunas from monsters.
{nl}I thank you for helping us gather all of the ingredients and saving Brunas.{nl}We finished diluting the poison while you were coming back.
{nl}We'll correct any misinformation on the Monument after removing the vegetation.
There was misinformation on the Monument, so we corrected it.{nl}We're going to go back and report to Lintas about our success here.
{nl}Thank you for helping us.
I am grateful to all of my apprentices who followed me all the way here.
I feel sorry that I haven't been able to teach them properly because of my mistakes and poor decisions.
I followed him to learn archery, not about shrubs.
Here I am ripping weeds out instead of at the archery range.{nl}I am seriously considering just going back home.
I told him that I don't want to pick at weeds anymore and he told me to wait here.{nl}I hope he won't tell me to go and gather leaves next.
I feel like I'll forget how to lose how to hold a bow.{nl}I should go and ask him to teach me archery instead of how to get rid of weeds.
I always picked on Jenonhas because of his direct way of communication.{nl}It seems like that we won't have to pick any more weeds thanks to him though.
They say that a person called Ignas became the leader of the Astral Tower because of a mistake he made.{nl}What sort of mistake gets the leader of the Astral Tower changed?
We followed him because we wished to learn archery.{nl}However, all he is doing is trying to find the Flechette.
It is pretty much impossible to find an arrow in this large area.
Jenonhas and Aquilas have a lot of resentment at the moment.{nl}Of course, Aquilas would rather keep his complaints under wraps.
Jenonhas on the other hand, is much more direct and forthcoming.{nl}I'm actually sort of amazed that he didn't say anything up to this point.
Jenonhas and Aquilas are as tired out as I am with this fruitless search.
There was a time when I asked him about what mistake he made to buy the wrath of the Astral Tower members.{nl}He didn't answer me at the time and looked into the distance while sighing.
It is said that Lydia Schaffen had defeated the Demon King Ghibulinas in this forest with the Flechette.{nl}However, Lydia Schaffen hadn't retrieved that fantastic arrow after that feat.
{nl}Why didn't Lydia Schaffen retrieve her arrow?
I tried my best to find the Flechette thinking that it would help him recover his honor.{nl}However, I was threatened by monsters and demons the whole time.
{nl}I thought that I might lose my life while trying to regain his honor.{nl}That's why I went to talk about the current situation.
{nl}I don't care if this will reflect poorly on me.{nl}It is better than watching my colleagues die trying to find an arrow.
I don't understand the Astral Tower's reaction to him either.{nl}Of course, I don't know what his mistake was but...
{nl}They are said to have gone through a lot together...{nl}I think that the members of the Astral Tower should forgive him now...
How sad do you think a Master would be if one of his apprentices lost their honor.{nl}Maven must have been extremely sad watching on as Ruklys lost his honor.
I am going to continue Maven's work by letting the people know the truth about Ruklys.
I will correct the misunderstandings that have been plaguing the Kingdom since King Kadumel's time.
This must be done no matter how hard it is to make people take another look at Ruklys.
Rewriting the history regarding Ruklys is needed in order to correct the misinformation that is included in our history.
Kidas and myself would have done our part once we check and correct this Monument.
We will correct the misinformation about Ruklys by correcting this Monument.
Ohla
Hello there!{nl}Have you seen my daughter by any chance?
{nl}She has twin-tails and is wearing a hood.{nl}Her name's Liel.
{nl}She disappeared without saying anything...{nl}I thought she had gone to a friend's house and checked there but there was no trace of her there.
{nl}I think she may have gone out of the Refugee Camp.{nl}I've tried asking people to help, but nobody seem to be willing to help me.
{nl}I know that it's asking a lot with the monsters threatening everyone but...{nl}I've come out since I was so worried but there doesn't seem to be anything I can do.
If there was anywhere I thought she might be, I would have gone there already...{nl}I guess we should try looking for places nearby.
{nl}Could you please try looking at Preivhengikas Felled Area?{nl}Where could she have gone with all of these monsters crawling around...{nl}
She's my only daughter and family since I lost my husband during Medzio Diena.{nl}She's all I have in this world now.
{nl}Please, find Liel for me...{nl}Please...
I don't know what my mother is thinking...{nl}Not even knowing that I left to get her some wool so she won't catch any more colds...
{nl}The fact that I couldn't do anything for her and that she had to go to...{nl}I am so sorry...
Thank the Goddess...{nl}I already don't know how to repay you for saving my daughter...
{nl}But you're offering to even get the wool...{nl}I don't know how I am to repay you for your generousity...
There's an insect called the White Tree Forest Moth...{nl}It's cacoons are known to be around here.
{nl}Liel used to go and gather them to use as silk.{nl}I don't know where she hears these things...
{nl}I know she's my daughter, but isn't she resourceful?
I'm just sorry that I can't offer her more.
We're searching this area for a Flechette.
I think that this should be enough to stitch the tent back up.{nl}Thank you so much for helping me.
Curtis
Ah, you must be the person who saved that girl, Liel.{nl}The way you simply dealed with the monsters that several young men weren't able to tackle...
{nl}Ah, look at me... I've forgetten to introduce myself.{nl}My name's Curtis.
{nl}I'm just another refugee who lost his family and home during Medzio Diena and is trying to get by.{nl}I don't think that coming here helped matters at all.
{nl}It's difficult getting things that are needed for basic survival.{nl}That means there are more conflicts between the refugees as well as theives...
{nl}We've tried to make some rules and set up defences against the monsters that keep attacking us but...
We were in dire need of help.{nl}If you're capable of saving Liel, I'm sure you're more than able to help us a bit more!
{nl}I know we might seem a tad ungrateful, but please...
{nl}There are many who haven't had a proper meal for a long time.{nl}We've lost the farmland that we took so much care of...
{nl}We need something to settle that hunger more than anything.{nl}Could you please get us some Flowlevi head flower?
{nl}When dried the seeds come out.{nl}We can cook them
The monsters in this area are a bit more fierce since they are all starving.{nl}Please don't try to bite off more than you can chew and just run if you think it's a bit too much.
Many people will have full stomaches today thanks to the food you've brought back.{nl}Thank you.
Monsters have been attacking us much more frequently.{nl}That's why we've put up those walls and distributed any weapons we could find to the young men.
{nl}The walls keep the monsters at bay, but we're worried that they aren't strong enough.{nl}They seem to break whenever monsters decide to start rampaging.
{nl}We're repairing them with wood each time.{nl}What I'm saying is that we use a lot of wood just repairing the walls.
Go to Saughus Lot with the tools I gave you.{nl}You'll be able to get a lot of good materials there.
{nl}After gathering some wood there, you'll be able to make some repair kits for the walls.
The problem was that the walls were weak since nobody had any knowledge on how to make them.{nl}They break down every time monsters decide to attack us.
{nl}That's why we have to keep repairing them every day.{nl}Of course that means we need a lot of wood as well.
This should be enough for one repair session.
I'll distribute the wood you've gathered to allow the repairs to start.
I know we've asked a lot, but please...{nl}All you need to do is to repair the wall in front of you.
The rest will be repaired by the other people.
We could have scraped by and repaired the walls but...{nl}I had no idea that you would help us so generously.
Michekan Forest is extremely cold at night.{nl}You'll catch frostbites if you don't wrap up tightly enough at night.
{nl}That's why we need a lot of clothes or covers that use Flowlon leathers.{nl}Of course it isn't easy for us to deal with the monsters in the first place...{nl}
This place is cold enough at night to make you shiver non-stop.
I think this will be enough for all the people here.
The worst part of this place is the lack of water.{nl}We did manage to set up a few wells here and there...
{nl}We haven't been able to drink it after the poison from the White Trees managed to trickle into the water supply.{nl}We've had to purify the water in one way or another.
{nl}We are using a grass called Randulin.
I'll give you a bottle of water.{nl}The problem is that Randulin usually is well hidden beneath the earth.
{nl}However, it will turn yellow when touched by the un-purified water here.{nl}You'll be able to see where the Randulin is by sprinkling the ground with this water.
A lot of people suffered greatly when we didn't know about the issues with the water.{nl}Aurlelse who is good with herbs, taught people how to purify the water.
Yes.{nl}What you have brought is indeed Randulin.
{nl}I think that will allow us to drink purified water for quite some time.
Did I tell you about the farmland that we had worked on?{nl}We had used the cable-car here in order to create arable land over at Lacetti Lot.

{nl}Even if it's a bit far from here, there's a lot of sunlight as well as soft soil.{nl}But we always had to be prepared to fix the old and worn cable-car since it was the only way for use to get there.
{nl}That's why we prepared tools to fix it at a moments notice in a pouch and place it somewhere we could find easily.{nl}The monsters mistook them for food bags and stole them all.
Monsters must have been starving too.{nl}Taking something they cannot eat...
Ah, yes.{nl}Those are the pouches.
There's still a problem left even if we are able to repair the cable-car again.{nl}As soon as we tilled the soil at Phavegheliai, monsters started attacking us there as well.
{nl}This is a matter of our survival.{nl}People will start starving if monsters are allowed to control that land for too long.
{nl}That's why I'm gathering young men to go and drive them off.
I knew that it wouldn't be something that a handful of people could accomplish...{nl}I believe that you'll manage to tip things in our favor even more.
Phavegheliai Farm will be on the other end of the cable-car that you get on at Lacetti Lot.
Liel...Are you there Liel?{nl}Where could she have gone to...{nl}I told her to not go out of the Refugee Camp...
If you see a girl with a hood that has twin-tails, please bring her here.
I'm looking for a girl with a hood and twin-tails.{nl}Her name is Liel. Have you seen her?
If you do find her, please bring her back to me.{nl}
Phavegheliai Farm was nothing but grasslands.{nl}It seemed perfect since there wasn't too many monsters and the sunlight was good here.
{nl}That's why we started to farm here and the crops made it well.{nl}Then, the monsters came after the crops and we lost control of the farm.
It seems like we'll be able to farm again thanks to you.{nl}I suppose it would be too much to ask you to stay with us?
{nl}Why don't you meet the people before you leave...{nl}I'm sure they'll have plenty to say to you.
You've listened to all of the worries of the people here?
{nl}I'm sure there wasn't one story that wasn't heartbreaking.{nl}Some feel like life here is nothing but trouble.
{nl}Some people say that I don't know about the severity of this situation, but I assure you that I do.{nl}This type of life will not be sustainable without material help from someone else.
{nl}I am sorry for the children as they will not be able to see the outside world.{nl}I have of course considered moving somehwere else.
{nl}However, we don't know exactly where we are in the Great Woodlands so we can't simply pick a direction either.{nl}We don't have enough food or supplies and the monsters are a never ending threat.
Really?
{nl}Thank you.{nl}We would appreciate it if you could go to a major city for help.
I see that there are refugees that haven't been able to receive proper assistance.{nl}I shall ask the lords near Michekan if they can't offer some help.
How did it go?{nl}Is there a city willing to help us?
The Knight Commander at Klaipeda said that he'd request help from the other lords?{nl}That's just what I wanted to hear.
{nl}Thank you so much for going the extra bit for us.
I shall ask the lords near Michekan Forest to aid the refugees.{nl}I'll try to make them hurry a bit as well.
Aurlelse
I think of the peaceful days before Medzio Diena every day.{nl}The Potato Dumplings I used to have with my wife were the best...
I lost my wife to a large branch that crashed on top of the house that day.{nl}I am regretful that I wasn't even able to properly bury her.
Alex
I am also afraid that I'll be attacked like Mr. Curtis.
{nl}He was attacked by monsters a while ago when trying to drive them out of town.{nl}I can still see him in pain because of the wounds.
If it wasn't for Medzio Diena, I would have married my love and be living a happy life...
Wickens
It wasn't too long after I came here.{nl}Waltas was stealing for his wife and baby.
{nl}He used to be someone that always looked out for other people...{nl}I realized that people change in harsh circumstances after seeing that.
I do somewhat understand why Waltas was stealing.
{nl}His wife had just given birth to their baby.{nl}But she wasn't able to feed the baby as she had been starving as well.
{nl}Waltas needed to get food for his wife and baby.
Myuse
Everyone at the refugee camp is grateful to Curtis, Aurlelse and Nagles.{nl}We wouldn't even be able to live like this if it wasn't for their help.
Although we have gotten it better, it is still a harsh life.{nl}It won't get any better if we don't get any help from the lords.
Liel
My mother... she gave me all of her blankets because she thought I would be cold.{nl}That's why she always has the cold and can't stop coughing...
{nl}I thought that less wind would come through the tent if I managed to stitch it and went to get some twine.{nl}There wasn't anything worth using in the refugee camp.
{nl}Curtis said that there were moths that made their cocoons up there.{nl}He said that they would be extremely good for strong twine.
I cannot tell my mother about it.{nl}She would forbid me from going out. No doubt about it.
{nl}I should have done this.{nl}My mother would be saddened if anything happens to me..
My mother always has nightmares ever since we came here.{nl}She always calls out to my father asking him to not go.
{nl}Then she wakes up crying.{nl}It is so painful to watch.
I remember eating Potato Dumplings with my parents.{nl}They tasted so good...
{nl}The sound of parents calling their children to dinner...{nl}The hard yet comfortable chairs...
Everything seemed impossible when we got here.{nl}Everyone was overwhelmed by the circumstances and there was nothing needed for survival... Not to mention the threat of monsters...
{nl}Despite all that, we were able to make it this far thanks to Aurlelse.
{nl}There had been a case of theft when food was scarce.{nl}I was one of the victims at the time.
{nl}People where incredibly angry at the time, including myself.{nl}When Waltas was discovered to be the criminal, we were just about to beat him.
{nl}However, Aurlelse gave him his food and defended him.{nl}Saying that he would have done the same if his baby was starving...
{nl}He also persuaded us that we should stick together even when times were tough.{nl}We all felt so embarrassed by his deeds...
{nl}We realized that simply protecting my own would not make matters better.{nl}That's when we started to collect our strength in order to overcome the situation.
{nl}As a result of the actions that day, things are getting a bit better.{nl}If Aurlelse hadn't stepped forward that day, there may not be anyone left alive here.
If there wasn't someone as brave as Nagles, there may have been nobody here willing to fight the monsters.{nl}Nagles was the one that raised the walls and found the weapons.
Nagles
We were able to live here this long thanks to Curtis.
I thought of what I could do after seeing Curtis working so hard for the people here.{nl}That's why I thought about protecting them from the monsters.
{nl}I also looked for anything that could be used as weapons around here.{nl}Surprisingly there was a worn down shack here with spears inside...
{nl}I gave the spears to young people like me and we started protecting the people.{nl}Then we raised the walls to make it harder for monsters to get in.
{nl}We didn't have enough materials or experience to build proper walls so their quite shabby.{nl}They're still worth their weight in Talt though!
Heres
Even if life here has gotten better, it's still unsafe.{nl}A time will come when it will become impossible for life to continue here without outside help.
Even if we wish to go and ask for help, we can't do so.{nl}Monsters are a threat of course, but the real issue is about the food.
{nl}We have no idea of telling how far deep we have gotten ourselves into the Great Woodlands.{nl}We don't know how much food we'll need to take to get to the next town.
Dreis
We are unable to distribute food because we lost the farms to the monsters.{nl}We are unable of taking the farms back from them as well.
There will be conflicts because of the lack of food soon if we don't do something about it.
Phadia
Monsters keep coming in even with the wall.{nl}They will continue to come here even if the people are standing guard with their weapons.
{nl}We all of our farmland to the monsters.{nl}Even if we manage to get it back, it won't be enough to feed us all.
{nl}It will only demoralize us even further.{nl}We won't be able to make it much more without the help from someone else.
You can't simply drink water from Michekan Forest because of the toxins.{nl}You'll suffer from stomache troubles if you do.
{nl}You have to drink it after purifying it with Randulin, but that's not easy to obtain either.{nl}You have to find it outside of the refugee camp where monsters are roaming around.
{nl}Nothing is easy here.
Wyatt
I did think that he was bringing more food than the others.{nl}I asked Waltas, but he simply said that he had found food at an empty shelter.
{nl}I didn't know anything back then.{nl}I never dreamed that he would be stealing for our baby...
{nl}Aurlelse defended my husband when he was discovered to be the theif.{nl}We would have been thrown out if it wasn't for him.
{nl}I am still thankful for Aurlelse and his actions.{nl}I am also sorry for all the people that were victims back then...{nl}
Waltas became a theif for our baby.{nl}I am not ashamed.
{nl}Aren't we in a situation where he had no other choice?
Waltas
Wyatt had to become a refugee late into her pregnancy, and had our baby as soon as we arrived here.{nl}There was only enough food to barely stave off starvation.
{nl}We managed to scrape by, but the baby was unable to be fed since Wyatt wasn't getting enough nutrition.{nl}The baby kept crying for food but there was none to give...I didn't know what to do.
{nl}That's why I stole food for my family...
{nl}However, my crimes were soon discovered by the rest of the people.{nl}Aurlelse defended me and my family just before I was beaten.
{nl}I am participating even more in order to right any wrongs and make up for my crimes.
We thought the food situation might get better since we managed to set up some farms but...{nl}We lost all of that to the monsters.
{nl}I'm worried that life might get even worse.
Ciatas
We've been able to manage until now, but we don't know when we'll meet our limits.
Of course I want to go and ask for help.{nl}But we don't know where we are and the monsters are crawling all over the place...
Rhupas
This place becomes really cold at night.{nl}You might even get frostbite if you don't wrap yourself up.
I don't know how we'll survive if we lose the farms.
Ohdette
Some people think that all we have to do is retake the farms but that's not true.{nl}We can't survive on the food from tha farms alone.
{nl}Monsters will keep raiding us since they know there's food in the camp.
We can't drive them out even if we arm everyone with weapons.{nl}They haven't been professionally trained.
Salewya
The people are getting worried.{nl}We somehow managed to get this far by sticking together, but there will be a time when that won't be enough...
{nl}That doesn't mean we have a way to survive if we leave this place.{nl}We don't have enough food to sustain the large population here moving at once either.
There are times when I wish this was all a dream.{nl}However, it feels more realistic every time I seem to wish that.
Daniels
Salewya wasn't always so dark.{nl}That happened after coming here.
{nl}It doesn't matter how much we tell her that we can overcome the difficulties here.
Salewya sometimes says that this whole life seems to be like a dream.{nl}That she'll wake up in a warm and comfortable bed...
{nl}I'm afraid she'll keep denying reality.
Hello there, are you trying to go in there?{nl}If so, could you please help me? It's a matter of life and death.
{nl}Please help!
Thank you so much for agreeing to help...{nl}I sent in a group of refugees that I organized into a group.{nl}None of them have been able to make it out even if it has been a few days.
I don't think that the legends written in that book are works of pure fiction.{nl}I don't know what we'll find but I will be able to solidify my position in the Merchant Alliance...
Mercenary Heranda
No! {nl}No!
{nl}No...
Who are you!{nl}Have you come to kill me as well?
{nl}It's a person...{nl}I don't recognize you though...
{nl}You have to be careful too!{nl}They're coming to get us!
{nl}Please deal with those monsters...{nl}Please!
No, no, it's over...{nl}We've all gone insane...
{nl}Why has this...{nl}Captain... Edeline...
You've dealt with all of the monsters?{nl}What are you talking about!
{nl}You're another illusion made from this curse as well...{nl}Of course...There couldn't be a person in this place could there...
{nl}Just leave me alone and go away...{nl}Please...
Who are you?{nl}You don't seem to be one of the Gigho Mercenaries...
{nl}Has Alta sent you to die in this cave as well?{nl}How did you get all the way in here?
Please find Heranda!{nl}She'll be taken by them if we don't hurry!
{nl}I'll explain to you later.
Oh no... Where could she have gone?{nl}What's that in your hands though?
These are records left by Heranda{nl}She must have fallen unconscious after suffering from illusions and fear.
{nl}I suppose it's lucky that Heranda left these here before she was cursed.{nl}I think I'll be able to make out where the others are after reading these.

{nl}She also mentions a creature that is hunting the people that have scattered due to the curse.{nl}We thought that we were save since we avoided the curse but...It seem we aren't out of the woods yet...
{nl}So they call this Ravinelarva outside of here.{nl}Could you deal with it to keep our people safe?
Thank you.{nl}I'll have to look for the location of the other members after reading Heranda's records a bit more.
My lover, Edeline, is the second in command of the Gigho Mercenaries.{nl}I was accompanying them because I was a bit worried about them.
{nl}I never thought that things would go so wrong...{nl}I am going to report Alta to the Merchant Alliance Headquarters when I get out of here with Edeline!
{nl}Alta drove people to die without telling them anything.{nl}It's not something that can be forgiven even if he didn't know about it...
I've been waiting with baited breath for you to return safely.{nl}I was worried that we'd be discovered.
I've been able to find where Heranda last saw the head of the Gigho Mercenaries from the records.{nl}After looking at their records... I think it's near the Novan Stone Pole Platform.
{nl}I'm sure that a lot of people will be there since he is the head of the Gigho Mercenaries!{nl}Edeline might be there as well.
{nl}Please find them and bring them back.{nl}I beg of you!
Commanding Officer Gigho
Who... are you...{nl}I've never seen you before...
{nl}Please help me...{nl}I've been badly wounded...
Have you found him?{nl}Please find them before they're all hunted down...
{nl}We're out of time!{nl}
Please... Please... I beg of you...{nl}Find my antidotes...
{nl}The others...They've all been captured and taken to the Vankas Stone Pole Platform...{nl}The same as Edeline...
{nl}Forget about those people... Save me instead...monster{nl}The antidotes...Monsters should be holding them...
Please... Please...{nl}At least save me...
Why have you returned by yourself?{nl}What about Edeline and the others?
{nl}It seems as if Gigho has gone just like Heranda...{nl}But I get that Edeline is at Vankas Stone Pole Platform.
Edeline...{nl}I can't believe that he could be thrown away like that after following Gigho for so long...
Why have you come back alone...Why!{nl}This necklace was my present to Edeline...
{nl}Ah...{nl}I'm sorry...
{nl}I didn't know that you've put your life at risk like that...{nl}I took my anger out on you.
I can't wait here for someone that won't return.{nl}Alta... We have to punish him.
{nl}Don't stop me!{nl}I'll go even if you try and stop me!
How did it come to this...{nl}How...
{nl}I'm finished if that priest reports me to headquarters!{nl}I feel sorry for my people but I have to make preparations...
{nl}Listen to me, we can't allow something similar to happen can we?{nl}Listen to me!
If what Celvica and you are saying is true, there must be some other record.{nl}We'd better find it.
{nl}It might be dangerous for you a bit but we need to uncover the truth. People's lives are at stake.{nl}Please, I beg of you.
Perhaps this is the legendary Alembique?{nl}What does that mean for me though...
This... will be extremely useful.{nl}It might be good enough to cover all of my mistakes...
{nl}I'll be able to explain everything if I fit everything to the legends of Alembique.{nl}Don't  you think?

It doesn't matter if the Kedoran Merchant Alliance is meant to search for the Goddess's arrangements...{nl}Their still merchants at heart so they'll listen to me if they know what they can get here...

{nl}Nobody has been here before so there will be research that can be performed on the monsters found here...{nl}That's why I want to ask if you'd be willing to deal with some of the monsters and get some of their remains for me.
Do I look like a capitalist and opportunist to you as well?{nl}If so, there isn't much that I can say...
{nl}Think of all of this as measures to keep any more people from getting hurt...
These stalactites seem to be harboring some sort of magical powers.{nl}The Alliance's researchers will have a field day with these.
{nl}I'm sure that they will be important materials that can be used to prevent any further loss of life!
I've been thinking after hearing from you and Celvica...
{nl}I can't stop but think that there's something in this cave that emits the strange aura.{nl}Maybe getting rid of those might be able to allow the surviving members to return?
{nl}I beleive that only you are capable of finishing this job.{nl}Since you don't seem to be affected by the curse at all.
I would like to help you but...{nl}You saw what happened to Heranda and Gigho right?
{nl}I might mistake you for a monster and start attacking you if I go in there...{nl}Of course I'm sure that I won't be a match for you but...
I feel like the aura has lessened a bit...{nl}What do you think?
Heranda! Is Heranda alive?{nl}Is Heranda okay?
{nl}This cave is cursed.{nl}People will go crazy if they aren't protected by divine energy like I am.
{nl}I have no idea why you're unaffected...{nl}There doesn't seem to be anything else that wants to attack us except the monsters.
{nl}Look at me, I've kept talking for too long.
{nl}People's lives depend on it.{nl}Please bring Heranda back here since you seem to be unaffected by the curse!
Celvica?{nl}Why?
{nl}Either way, she still hasn't come here...{nl}I'm glad you've made it though.
I assure you that this is not simply for my own benefit...
Leave me... alone...
The Cave of Legends : Revised Edition Volume 1
There have been many tales{nl}of mysterious locations{nl}long before written history.{nl}This book contains three{nl}of those wonderous locations.{nl}

The reasoning behind selecting{nl}the particular locations is as follows.{nl}{nl}The masses are only a little less interested{nl}about riches such as treasure and gold{nl}than they are about the Goddesses.{nl}{nl}We will start with the legends of Alembique.

Chapter 1 Legends of Alembique{nl}-{nl}There are tales of a cave named Alembique{nl}in the southern province of Kiren.{nl}{nl}It is said that a brilliant alchemist{nl}created many invaluable goods{nl}and occasionally invited people{nl}to show off to them.

Nobody seems to know the location{nl}of the mysterious Alembique Cave.{nl}{nl}However, older people in several villages{nl}tell their descendants of being invited to the cave,{nl}and not wanting to leave the place{nl}as they had experienced never before seen luxuries.{nl}{nl}Therefore, people from these villages{nl}have a habit of congratulating any people that have gone missing{nl}and hope that they will also be invited one day.
The Cave of Legends : Revised Edition Volume 2

The reasoning behind selecting{nl}the particular locations is as follows.{nl}{nl}The masses are only a little less interested{nl}about riches such as treasure and gold{nl}than they are about the Goddesses.{nl}{nl}We will now go on to the hidden Royal Mausoleum.

Chapter 2 : Legends of the Hidden Royal Mausoleum{nl}-{nl}The Great Woodlands have been used by the nobles and public alike{nl}as hunting grounds or refuge thanks to their lush vegetation.{nl}As such, it is an inevitability that people have experience.{nl}However, the funny thing is{nl}there is no account related to the royal family.{nl}According to some rumors,{nl}the reason for lack of accounts is because after Taniel II era.{nl}Many offerings were buried in the secret mausoleum.

QUEST_LV_0400_20161005_000001: {nl}그런데 이상하게도 왕실과 관련된{nl}이야기는 없는데 그 이유가{nl}타니엘 2세 시대에 이곳에{nl}비밀 왕릉을 만든 후 엄청난{nl}부장품을 함께 묻었기 때문이라는{nl}소문이 있습니다.

Kedoran Alliance Merchant Alta: What I am saying is that{nl}the Royalty seemed to leave this place alone{nl}as there was a secret place here.

To be frank, record of Taniel the Second's funeral{nl}are extremely sparse{nl}which lends extra credibility to these claims.{nl}That is because the other funerals{nl}had some sort of records{nl}no matter how small.{nl}However, even if these claims are true{nl}the Mausoleum will never see the light of day.

The location of the secret mausoleum remains hidden{nl}for it is almost impossible to avoid{nl}the gaze of  Goddess Medeina.{nl}That is why even if the rumors are true, it is likely that it will remain just a legend.

QUEST_LV_0400_20161005_000001: 아무리 깊은 숲속에서 몰래{nl}왕릉의 위치를 캐고 다니고 싶어도{nl}대삼림지대를 돌보시는 {nl}메데이나 여신의눈을{nl}피하기는 어렵기 때문입니다.{nl}그러므로 이 소문은 설령{nl}사실이라도 영원히 전설로만{nl}남을 것 같습니다.

Kedoran Alliance Merchant Alta: The Cave of Legends : Revised Edition Volume 3

The reasoning behind selecting{nl}the particular locations is as follows.{nl}{nl}The masses are only a little less interested{nl}about riches such as treasure and gold{nl}than they are about the Goddesses.{nl}{nl}We will continue with the legends of the Golden Veins of Barconsi.

Chapter 3 : The Golden Veins of Barconsi{nl}-{nl}There are tales that there is a legendary gold vein{nl}in the rural mountains of the Kingdom.{nl}It is said that a demon had found this vein{nl}and a hero defeated the demon before claiming it.
It is also said that the hero{nl}only took the vein to prevent the demon from using it{nl}and had no interest in using it for himself.{nl}That is why he buried the location forever.
The hero eventually passed away from old age{nl}and left no children leaving the gold{nl}up for anyone to take if they could find it.
However, there is something suspicious{nl}about this legend.{nl}There is no record of Barconsi,{nl}the hero who supposedly took the gold from the demon{nl}in any of the Kingdom's records.

As such, many people believe that{nl}this legend is fictional{nl}as there is no record of Barconsi.{nl}However, they do not try to explain{nl}why Barconsi's name is involved.{nl}Of course, there are also many people{nl}that keep searching for the gold.
Refugee Brandon
I should have listened when everyone was telling me off!{nl}This forest is dangerous!
I don't understand why that hunter would want to keep this forest for himself.
Umm, could you help me?
{nl}I barely managed to get out of a trap, but I hurt my leg and can't go any further.{nl}Please help me.
There's some Whitetailed Grass at Turas Lot... They say it will relieve pain.{nl}I think I'll manage to walk if I'm chewing on that.
There should be some in the surrounding area.{nl}Could you get some for me?
Thank you so much.{nl}I'm going to get out of here.
{nl}There seems to be a violent hunter that wants to claim this land as his own.{nl}I doubted that until I got caught in one of his traps.
{nl}From what I've heard, he's known to have tamed a beast in order to chase people off...{nl}You should avoid getting any deeper into the forest as well.
I thought you were simply a nosy adventurer, but you seem to be a cut above the rest.
Let me introduce myself.{nl}My name is Vilhelmas.
{nl}I used to be a member... Actually, let's forget about the past since it's not important.
{nl}Emmet Forest has only been recently discovered.{nl}It seems like a good place for refugees, so I was getting rid of the troublesome monsters.
{nl}There's also a beast here...
{nl}You know, the rumors are mostly true... Apart from those about me of course.{nl}I am on my way to get rid of that beast.
I appreciate the thought but... I'll have to see your skill before I'll allow it.{nl}I don't want there to be your blood on my hands.
Their saying that I tamed the beast to chase people off?{nl}That's really disheartening...
I never thought you would be a Revelator...{nl}Maybe the fact that you came here was also a plan of a Goddess or two.
I thought that you were skilled, but never thought that you were a Revelator.
As I told you before, this is a good place for people to live.{nl}This means that this is a good place for the refugees from the Old Capital.
{nl}First of all, the Kugheri must be removed in order for people to settle here.{nl}But we'll have to deal with the beast before we can tackle the Kugheri.
{nl}I was getting tired of tracking him because of the curse anyways.{nl}I'd appreciate it if you could help me a bit...
{nl}Of course, the beast is more than capable, which means that there will be casualties if you're not strong enough.{nl}Would you mind if I test your skills?
It wasn't long after I started dealing with the Kugheri.{nl}One of the demons came crashing through Emmet Forest.
{nl}I don't care what a demon would come here for.{nl}I simply took care of it.
{nl}It was relatively easy defeating it.{nl}But there were complications.
{nl}He cursed me when he was cornered.{nl}My sight is severely hindered due to that stupid curse.
{nl}Anyways, he put a red gem through himself after that.{nl}He started to transform after that.
{nl}I'm sure you might have guessed from listening up to this point, but the beast is the demon.{nl}I realized at once that the demon was much more dangerous than before.
{nl}Of course, he had a bit of fear left for me and ran as well.{nl}The long and boring fight between the two of us has been dragging on ever since then.
{nl}Tracking that thing with this curse wasn't easy.{nl}Having limited vision as a hunter is  almost a death sentance.
{nl}I put up warnings to ward people away but refugees kept coming in despite of my efforts.{nl}I think I'll be able to settle this fight once and for all with your help though.
{nl}Please, lend me your strength.
Very good.{nl}Try dealing with the Kugheri of this forest.{nl}If you are able to deal with them, you might be good enough to take on the beast with me.
Please prove your skills by dealing with the Kugheri.
Hmm... You are definitely skilled.{nl}I think I'll be able to defeat the beast if I fight with you.
{nl}You're a bit too good...{nl}You're not just the average traveler are you? What are you?
So you're the...!{nl}Now I understand your skill.
{nl}Well then Revelator, you should help me out with a problem I have here.
I think we'll give that idea a try since I have someone to help me now.{nl}I think we'll be able to critically injure the beast.
{nl}The plan is to plant a trap where he normally travels and then for me to hit the beast with a poison arrow.{nl}I'll have to gather ingredients for the poison, but I can't do this alone.
{nl}The first ingredient for the poison can be taken from the Kugheri.{nl}I can't see them until I get near them, but they run if I get too close.
{nl}Could you gather the ingredients for me?
Thank you.{nl}You'll be able to get the poison from Kugheri Tots.

{nl}They seem to have poison for protection purposes when they're young, but simply taking that poison won't be enough.{nl}The poison will become much more potent if you spray them with this stimulant.
{nl}Defeat them and bring me the enhanced poison sacks.
Approach the Kugheri Tots and defeat them after spraying them with stimulant.{nl}Take the poison sacks from them after defeating them.
Good job.{nl}You'll have to move with me for the next ingredient.
The next ingredient is the Yellow Wolfsbane.
{nl}However, we can't use any flower.{nl}Only a professional will be able to see which flower can be used.
{nl}I'll decide which flowers can be used since you won't be able to tell the difference.{nl}All you have to do is lead me to the flowers since I can't see where they are.
They should be growing near Saalmas Falls.{nl}We should get moving at once.
Thank you.{nl}I'll start mixing the poison.
We have enough ingredients for the poison now.{nl}However...{nl}I seem to be fresh out of materials for the traps.
{nl}The Kugheri Sommi always carry paralysis poison to use on small animals.{nl}It can be used on larger targets if you have enough of it.
{nl}Could you gather the poison from them?
Thank you.{nl}I'll be making other preparations.
Bring me paralysis poison gathered from the Kugheri Sommi.
That took longer than expected.{nl}Let's go and finish the trap.
We're all set to go.{nl}I just have to install this.
I tracked the beast and mixed the poison while you were gathering the poison for the trap.{nl}He leaves a red trail behind him. It may be a bit faint for you to see.
{nl}I think it's because of the red gem he put through himself.{nl}Anyways, I found a small trail where he frequently goes by.
{nl}I think we should install the trap on the way up to Saalmas Falls from Tredhalai Stream.{nl}I'll be hiding at Visuobene Falls and hit him with the poison arrow as soon as he is trapped.
{nl}It should be enough to critically injure the beast.{nl}All you have to do is install the trap where I just described.
Make sure to install it exactly where I described.{nl}I won't be able to hit him if it's not in the correct place.
Go and install the trap before the beast goes through.
I'll have to rest here for a bit.{nl}Vaighe Hill is a dead end so we won't have to worry too much.
{nl}You'll have to end it by yourself.{nl}It should have been weakened considerably because of the poison arrow.
Don't worry about me and go after it!{nl}Before it can recover!
He's gone to a dead end.{nl}This is the opportune moment to finish it!
We should recover all of the traps we set to catch the beast.{nl}We can't have people like you stepping on them now can we?
May the Goddess bless your journey.{nl}I hope you will be able to succeed in your mission.
I won't be caught out by the Kugheri even if I am wounded.{nl}Hurry after him and finish the job.
Yes...{nl}The long fight has finally come to an end.
{nl}I don't know when this would have ended if it wasn't for you.{nl}I think my eyesight is returning now that the beast is gone.
{nl}I owe you.{nl}I would appreciate it if you could stay behind and help me clean this place up...
{nl}I'm sure you have your mission as Revelator.{nl}I don't know how I'll repay you for the help you gave.
{nl}Farewell then.{nl}I wish you the best on your journey.
Anyone who goes beyond this point will put their life at risk.{nl}Go back while you still can.
I advise you to be careful as there are violent Kugheri and armed traps.
Refugee Mylija
I came here after hearing that it was okay, but I think it was a bad decision on my part.{nl}Monsters are crawling everywhere... People are fighting amongst each other...
I can't beliece that it's been four years since Medzio Diena and they're still fighting over stupid land.
At least they're talking to each other instead of simply fighting.{nl}I wish we could know who to rely on soon.
I hope that everything will be finished without bloodshed.{nl}I'm a bit worried that there may be complications since they don't exactly have a good history together.
I am thankful that the argument is over since they've decided to help us even if they haven't decided the winner.
Thank you for your help Traveler.{nl}This was all thanks to you.
Ah, it's you...{nl}Could you help us out?
{nl}The food we've brought with us is long gone...{nl}We've asked the lords supposed to be ruling this region, but they are too busy squabbling between themselves to help us.
{nl}Since you seem to be capable of dealing with some monsters, we have no choice but to ask you...{nl}Could you please gather some tailfruit from the Yellow Leafnuts after dealing with them?
Thank you.{nl}I think all that's left to eat around these parts are the tailfruits from the Leafnuts.
Please gather some tailfruit from the Yellow Leafnuts in the surrounding area.
Thank you so much.{nl}We'll manage for a while with these but... I hope that they'll decide who will rule this region as soon as possible...
Refugee Greg
We came all the way here for help but have to fend for ourselves...{nl}This makes this place exactly like anywhere else.
How could they be squabbling over land in such situations...{nl}I guess I can't expect any better from nobles can I...
Well, at least they're better than the average noble.{nl}It seems like they've caught on to the situation after being attacked by monsters.
I heard that you were the reason behind their sudden agreement.{nl}I don't know how I will repay you for this.
Monsters are attacking us refugees a few times every single day.{nl}What's the use of having a lot of soldiers nearby.{nl}They're all busy protecting their lords.
{nl}Even worse, they don't care if the refugees here die or not.{nl}All they seem to care about is getting more land under their boots.
{nl}That's why we have to look for ways to look after ourselves.{nl}I'm sorry, but could you please get us some strong branches from the nearby area?
{nl}We're planning on having them as weapons.{nl}I will have to stay here in order to carve their points to use as weapons.
Thank you so much for offering your help.{nl}We've already taken this much from the surrounding area, so you'll have to look over at Collegia Crossing for more.
{nl}There's always monsters near branches, so please be careful out there.
Be wary of monsters when collecting branches.
Thank you.{nl}They all look very sturdy.
{nl}However, they are still just tree branches... We won't last long with these.{nl}We need the fighting between the two lords to end soon...
{nl}Only the Goddess will know if they'll care about us even if it does end soon.
I saw you helping Greg.
{nl}I've seen you helping us out and dealing with monsters with ease...{nl}You don't seem to be just an ordinary traveler.
{nl}We... we'll have to leave this place if the lords don't stop arguing soon.{nl}However, we are afraid of going into Emmet Forest because of the warnings and strange rumors about the place.
{nl}In other words, we don't have anywhere to go.{nl}So, please, could you find it in your heart to go and mediate?
You'll help us right?
{nl}Ah, thank the Goddesses...
{nl}I'm sure that you'll manage to persuade them.
{nl}Lord Ryudhas is ruling over the land in place of his sick brother.{nl}He is a very stubborn man.{nl}He's staying at Dhuvus Lot.
{nl}Lord Joquvas is a young lad who has recently come into power.{nl}He is at Nevhrandi Crossroads with his tutor.
{nl}We always get turned away every time we go near them.{nl}Please go and talk some sense into them.
Lord Ryudhas is at Dhuvus Lot,{nl}Lord Joquvas is at Nevhrandi Crossroads.{nl}Please convince them to stop arguing.
That was incredible!{nl}I didn't think that you'd be able to convince both of them...
Lord Ryudhas
Not anyone can simply go and talk to a lord.{nl}That has not changed despite how the rest of the world has changed since Medzio Diena.
I am currently running my family's business in my brother's place as he is ill.{nl}I will not ignore anyone who is threatening my family's rule.
You have my word since you have dutifully carried out the tasks I have set for you.{nl}I will attempt to talk to Joquvas.
All I promise is to attempt to talk.{nl}The fact that this is my family's land is not something that can be compromised.
Who are you to stand in front of me?
{nl}You are all as useless as a Kepa.{nl}How dare you allow this outsider to come near me...
{nl}I suppose you have a reason why you've decided to interrupt me?{nl}What business do you have with me, the representative for Lord Ryudhas?
The reason I am fighting with the Joquvas lad?
{nl}It's not even really a fight.{nl}I am simply notifying him of my family's right.
{nl}I have in my possession an official document that proves my right to the land here.{nl}That miserable lad is merely being a nuisance.
{nl}I am not as compromising as my brother.{nl}This is the rightful land of the Ryudhas family.{nl}I will not back down.
I was wondering what sort of nonsense you would tell me.{nl}Why do I need to talk to the lad about my rightful land?
{nl}You've been asked by the refugees...?{nl}The refugees over there?
{nl}Well, I suppose I cannot simply ignore the requests of my people as lord of this land.{nl}I might consider your request if you complete some tasks I set for you.
{nl}A few of my men seem to have caught a plague.{nl}They must be cured before it can spread so go and fetch me some roots from the Pysis plant.
Go and fetch me some Pystis roots from nearby.
Good.{nl}However, we need more to craft the medicine we need.
Ryudhas Guard
Get back from our lord!
You are standing in front of Lord Ryudhas.
Another ingredient is needed to craft the medicine. The legs of the Orange Grummer.{nl}Of course, you'll need to forcefully take it from them, so it may be too much for you.
{nl}Of course, I can simply give this task to another person if you don't want to do it.
Hmm... I am surprised.{nl}I don't know who you are, but why are you working so hard for the refugees?
{nl}Well, whatever the case, fine.{nl}If you have decided to accept the task, go fetch me the Orange Grummer legs.
My men will be able to be treated if you get me those Orange Grummer legs.
You seem to be more efficient than you look.{nl}If you keep up the good work, I may consider making more personal requests.
This is not only my family's land but also land that I have many found memories about.
{nl}There is a tree at Atmintis Lot where my brother and I used to see how tall we were.{nl}I wish to retrieve a toy box buried under it.
{nl}However, it's located where the lad from Joquvas is claiming as his own, so my soldiers cannot go.
{nl}I doubt he will be alarmed at you rummaging around.{nl}Could you get that box for me?
{nl}I wish to take it to my ill brother.
Good.{nl}I will consider talking to the lad if you get me that box.
{nl}I suppose that the tree will still have the marks from when we were young but...{nl}From the state of the trees nearby, I think that it will also be covered in moss.
{nl}The fluid of the Red Colimen has strong acidic properties so gather that first.{nl}After that, go and liquidify the moss on the trees and check for any marks.
{nl}It you find a tree with marks, dig underneath it for a box.
Go and get rid of the moss on trees at Atmintis Lot for a tree with marks.{nl}Dig under it to get a box.
This brings up memories.{nl}It is the same as I remember it even if it is a bit worn.{nl}I will listen to your request since you have kept your end of the deal.
{nl}I will send a person to Joquvas.{nl}I will not press any harder if the Joquvas lad refuses to talk.
Lord Joquvas
You lowly thing!{nl}How dare you speak to me.
If you have business worthy of my time, tell it to Roberta.
Roberta says that it is fine to listen even if it does not effect my decision.{nl}Therefore, I shall listen to what you have to say.
If the refugees wish to receive my help, isn't it correct to recognize me as the rightful owner of this land first?
You must go through me if you have anything to say to Lord Joquvas.
I have taught our lord since he was young.
{nl}As such, I have his absolute trust.{nl}You will have to convince me in order to convince our lord.
I keep my promises.{nl}I will convince our lord in order to have a conversation with the other side.
However, I don't understand.{nl}Why is a simple traveler so interested in the requests of mere refugees?
{nl}It's not like you're a Savior or anything.
Of course, there would have been no doubt about this land belonging to the Joquvas family...{nl}But I suppose there is no choice but to change along with the times.
I will convince our lord to be more mindful of the refugees once the new boundaries are settled.
Joquvas Guard
Talk to Robertas if you have any business.
Don't you dare approach Lord Joquvas!
What is this man?{nl}Get back I tell you!
Please calm yourself.{nl}Traveler, you must go through me if you have any business with our lord.
I am our lords most humble servant, Roberta.{nl}What is your business?
Who do you think you to speak to the lord?{nl}Talk to Roberta if you have any business!
Not anyone can simply come to speak to our lord.{nl}You must be seen as worthy of his attention before I consider telling him your business.
{nl}It is not too difficult.{nl}Simply go and deal with some pesky Red Colimen and I will consider your request.
Go and deal with the Red Colimen.{nl}I shall listen to you after that.
Good.{nl}Now, shall we listen to what you have to speak of?
Negotiations with the representative of Lord Ryudhas... You have brought me an annoying task.{nl}Our lord is embarrassed by the fact that he is facing a man that isn't even an actual lord.
{nl}However, I don't think we can simply ignore this.{nl}I don't think that the refugees recognize the true lord either...
{nl}I suppose that we will need to show more solid evidence.{nl}If you bring me what I ask of you, I will consider convincing our lord to listen to you.
You'll be able to see some wreckage near Arcmnys Lake.{nl}It used to be the residence of our grounds keeper.
{nl}There should be objects around there with the seal of the Joquvas family there.{nl}We can't go there because of the Ryudhas soldiers, so you'll have to go and retrieve them.
Look for objects belonging to the Joquvas family near the wreckage at Arcmnys Lake.
That is... a shield.{nl}I can confirm that there is a seal of the Joquvas family on it.
{nl}Very good, but this will not be enough.{nl}I believe that you must help with another task before I recognize you as worthy of audience.
The Joquvas family always set up Monument made of stone.{nl}We will be able to make the refugees accept the Joquvas family as the rightful rulers.
{nl}We've found a few places that the monuments might be, but we can't go there.{nl}We can't remove any of the soldiers from guarding our lord because of all the monsters.
{nl}We don't know when the soldiers from Ryudhas might attack either...
{nl}From the look of things, you are skilled enough to protect me if you accompany me while I investigate the Monuments.{nl}Would you mind accompanying me?
Good. We'll have to check Paccituche Trail, Skalda Road and Lyfetie Cliffs.{nl}Shall we go then?
Good work.{nl}The refugees will now know who the rightful owner of this land is.
{nl}Ah... I will try and talk to our lord about what you have told me.{nl}A promise is a promise.
{nl}However, we will only agree to simple conversation.{nl}There is no doubt in the fact that this land belongs to the Joquvas family.
There's a slight issue.
{nl}Before you came back, the lords started negotiations in the lot just over there.{nl}The atmosphere isn't friendly though...
{nl}I think you may want to go and take a look.
The lords are meeting in the lot nearby.
I think I had been forgetting something very important while I focused on the land.{nl}We, the Ryudhas family, will support the refugees here with all available resources.
I never thought the monsters would be so strong.{nl}Did they not attack us properly the entire time?
I don't like it, but I suppose I don't have a choice since we decided on the new boundaries.{nl}There will be no more fighting with the Ryudhas family.
Roberta should now how to take care of the refugees.{nl}I will listen to Roberta's advice as always.
My men... All of them have perished!{nl}I owe my life to you.
{nl}Thank you.
I never thought the monsters would be so strong!{nl}Thank the goddesses I didn't bring Roberta.
Yes... This is not the time for us to argue over the land.{nl}We must stand together and fight back the monsters.
It is as you have told me.{nl}We will be able to focus on ruling our land since the boundaries have been set.
While I do think that this is my family's land...{nl}I suppose one should know how to take a step back under such circumstances.
{nl}Ah well.{nl}I will negotiate with the Ryudhas about the new boundaries.
The negotiations are over.{nl}We have decided to use this road as the boundary.
{nl}We have decided to take care of the refugees now that the conflict has been settled.
The lad is more agreeable than I thought he would be.{nl}We have decided to care for the refugees since the new boundary has been set.
We will install notifications on the new boundary.{nl}I think that setting one at Pastoghe Bend, Collegia Crossing and Paccituche Trail should be enough.
{nl}You have done well as mediator.{nl}I give my word that I will take care of the refugees.
I don't like the results, but what can be done?{nl}The Ryudhas also had some good points in their arguements.
The Kukheri Tribe and demons...{nl}Investigating Syla Forest has become much more dangerous.
What I am attempting to do has the lives of many people on the line.{nl}However, it is... extremely difficult. I would appreciate it if I could get some help but...
I can't believe I am receiving the help of a Revelator here. It seems as if the Goddesses have not forsaken the Kingdom yet.
I think that the ancient knowledge from the Royal Mausoleum of Taniel the Second will help the reconstruction of the Kingdom.
Vhalterris was a powerful and tenacious demon.{nl}I doubt that anyone other than the Revelators would have been able to take Vhalterris down.
There shouldn't be anything in Taniel the Second's Royal Mausoleum fit for demons to go after...
{nl}I can't fathom what they wanted from that place...{nl}Simply the interferance of the Kingdom's reconstruction? The assumption that a Revelator would be there?
Hmm?{nl}You must be quite skilled to make it this far.
{nl}My name is Indraja, an adventurer.{nl}I have received a request to go and investigate places where the refugees might stay while the Kingdom is being reconstructed.
{nl}I never thought that I would run into demons here.{nl}My bodyguard, Marcus, was wounded while protecting me.
{nl}I would like to prevent the monsters from getting closer.{nl}Could you please help us a bit?
Thank you.{nl}We sprinkled liquid that the Kugheri Tribe dislikes, but it doesn't seem to be enough.{nl}We have the ingredients to make more, but we are out of water.
{nl}It is said that the Syla Dandelion holds dew in it's flowers.{nl}Could you please gather the dew from the flowers?
Please bring me the dew from Syla Dandelions.
Thank you.{nl}We'll be able to rest a bit easier thanks to you.
{nl}While I realize that this may be rude... I must ask... {nl}Looking at your skill and appearance... Are youa Revelator?
I thought you might be.{nl}I have heard many stories.
{nl}This is an honor.{nl}If you are a Revelator, I should tell you my real mission.
Marcus
Do not approach...!{nl}This person is on an important mission!
Kukheri Tribe...{nl}They have become much stronger in a short time...
I have heard many rumors...{nl}I hope that you will find it in your heart to help...
You are already being trusted by many people...{nl}You will be able to earn the trust of Royalty if you help with this mission.
Let me introduce myself once more.{nl}I am not an adventurer.
{nl}I am here on the orders of General Lhamin who is attempting to reconstruct the Kingdom.{nl}It is to find Taniel the Second's Royal Mausoleum which is rumored to be in Syla Forest.
{nl}Marcus is an officer here to protect me but he has been wounded.{nl}Please, could you help me finish my mission?
Thank you.{nl}We were attacked by the Kugheri on behalf of the demons.
We knew that they didn't like humans, but we didn't know that they would attack us with such numbers.{nl}They must have made an agreement with the demons.
{nl}They are sure to be searching for us nearby.{nl}Please reduce their numbers a bit.
General Lhamin is trying to reconstruct the Kingdom.{nl}He wishes to utilize anything possible to do so.
{nl}He had come across a legend that had been passed down by Royalty.
{nl}It is said that Taniel the Second had created another Royal Mausoleum.{nl}It is said that much information was stored there to prepare for some sort of catastrophe.
{nl}The General firmly believes that the information stored there will be of great help.
{nl}It is said that you must be of Royal descent in order to find the Royal Mausoleum's entrance.{nl}That's why I have been honorably chosen as a far relative of the Royalty.
{nl}However, I never thought that the demons would be searching for the Royal Mausoleum as well.
{nl}There were two demons, but I spread misinformation and made one to to Emmet Forest.{nl}The other followed us here.
{nl}We wouldn't have been able to continue on our mission if we hadn't met you here.
Please deal with the Kugheri Zeuni and Kugheri Zabbi that are after us.
Thank you.{nl}However, we won't be able to rest easy until we deal with the demon behind them.
You have something for me?
{nl}...{nl}These are the orders from the demon!
{nl}I don't know how the Kugheri were able to read this.{nl}I have learned of their language, so let me take a look and try to make something of it.{nl}
I wasn't able to decipher the orders you brought me.{nl}I am sure that there are more orders...
{nl}Maybe I'll be able to make sense of them if I am able to compare and contrast the letters.{nl}I'm sorry, but could you please get me more of the demon's orders?
Thank you. You said that you gathered them from the Kugheri Zabbi?{nl}Please get me more of them from the Kugheri Zabbi on the road to Stabhas Lot.
The Kugheri Zabbi should have more orders.{nl}I might be able to make some sense of it with more references.
Thank you.{nl}I'll try to figure out what the demon was scheming.
I've looked at all of the material you brought me.{nl}Where to begin...
{nl}It is said that the demon going after the Royal Mausoleum is called Vhalterris.{nl}Unlike his colleague, he has been chasing us quite cleverly.
{nl}Marcus allowed us to both escape but...{nl}We lost a chest related to the Royal Mausoleum's secret.
{nl}According to these orders, it seems as if he has yet to unravel the secret held within that chest.
{nl}Revelator.{nl}I know that this is a difficult request, but could you please retrieve that chest for me?
Thank you.{nl}He seems to be wondering around Apeighos Altar since he was unable to unravel the secret.
Please retrieve the chest after defeating Vhalterris.
Thank you.{nl}We've been able to get the chest back and remove the demon at the same time thanks to you!
Now we'll be able to focus on searching for the entrance.{nl}However, there is something more I should tell you.
{nl}We will only be able to find the entrance if we solve various puzzles.{nl}The chest you brought back is the start of the puzzles.
{nl}An important clue is stored in the chest you retrieved, but it will not simply open.{nl}We will have to learn how to open it with the five colors on this lock.

{nl}According to legend, there are five trees near the hidden entrance of the Royal Mausoleum, and those trees will indicate different colors.{nl}I can't leave Marcus behind, so could you please survey the trees instead?
Here, take this engraving and map.{nl}This engraving, which has the Royal Seal, is said to have magic infused on it.
{nl}It is said to be part of a set with the box and will react to the trees there.
{nl}The map is supposed to have the location of the trees marked on it.{nl}Go to each tree marked on the map and see which colors it reacts to.
Go to the trees marked on the map and use the Royal Seal to see how they react to each tree.
I sent Marcus back to Fedimian since he recovered enough to travel by himself.{nl}How is your investigation going?
{nl}Red... and blue...
{nl}Ah...!
{nl}Of course!
{nl}I think I know how to open it!
The chest has opened!
{nl}Let's see here... There's a stone slate.
{nl}Let me see what it says.{nl}Hmm...
Grasp the time at which you are granted audience with the King.{nl}The guardian will appear as the King looks down upon your last light.
{nl}Ah... This seems to be another riddle.{nl}We should go to Lykhas Crossroads since it's mentioned in the records and go see what can be found.
There was a bit more content on the slate...{nl}It seems as if it requires the blood from royalty to be read.
{nl}I suppose this was the reason they needed royalty to find the entrance.
{nl}However, the seal seems to be damaged since it has been passed down for generations.{nl}It seems to have consumed all of it's magic when you where investigating the trees.
{nl}We'll have to look for a way to recharge the seal.
All that's left is to find the Royal Mausoleum's entrance since we've seen the guardian.{nl}Please stick around a little bit more.
